titles.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate that supporting a balance between work and personal life is in the best interest of national worker productivity, and that the President should issue a proclamation designating October of 2003 as "National Work and Family Month".

action.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.
Senate Committee on the Judiciary discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and an amendment to the Title and an amended preamble by Unanimous Consent.

bill.summary: Expresses the sense of the Senate that: (1) reducing the conflict between work and family life should be a national priority; and (2) October 2003 should be designated as National Work and Family Month.
